se.cbb.jprime.topology

Interface RootedTree

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AcyclicDigraph, Graph
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    RootedBifurcatingTree, RootedBifurcatingTreeParameter, RootedTreeParameter
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    RBTree, RTree

    public interface RootedTree
extends AcyclicDigraph
    Specialised interface for a multifurcating rooted tree, required to consist of one sole component with at least one vertex. We also require that interior vertices do not have out-degree 1 (and could thus be collapsed). See the super-interface for more details.
    Author:
    Joel Sj√∂strand.

    • Method Detail

      • getRoot

        int getRoot()
        Returns the root vertex. Guaranteed not to be null, as there is always at least one vertex.
        Returns:
        the root.

      • getChildren

        java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> getChildren(int x)
        Returns the immediate children of a vertex. If no children exist, an empty list is returned. There is no guarantee that the list appears sorted or in any particular order. Equivalent to getDirectSuccessors();
        Parameters:
        x - the vertex.
        Returns:
        all y such that there is an arc (x,y).

      • getNoOfChildren

        int getNoOfChildren(int x)
        Returns the number of children of a vertex. Equivalent to getNoOfDirectSuccessors();
        Parameters:
        x - the vertex.
        Returns:
        the number of children.

      • getDescendants

        java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> getDescendants(int x,
                                               boolean properOnly)
        Returns the descendants of a vertex. If lacking descendants, an empty list is returned. There is no guarantee that the list appears sorted or in any particular order. Equivalent to getSuccessors(), but extended with the possibility to include the vertex itself.
        Parameters:
        x - the vertex.
        properOnly - set to false to include x among descendants.
        Returns:
        the proper/improper descendants of x.

      • getNoOfDescendants

        int getNoOfDescendants(int x,
                     boolean properOnly)
        Returns the number of descendants of a vertex. Equivalent to getNoOfSuccessors(), but extended with the possibility to count the vertex itself.
        Parameters:
        x - the vertex.
        properOnly - set to false to include x among descendants.
        Returns:
        the number of proper/improper descendants of x.

      • getDescendantLeaves

        java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> getDescendantLeaves(int x,
                                                    boolean properOnly)
        Returns the descendant leaves of a vertex. If lacking descendants, an empty list is returned. There is no guarantee that the list appears sorted or in any particular order. Equivalent to getSuccessorSinks(), but extended with the possibility to include the vertex itself.
        Parameters:
        x - the vertex.
        properOnly - set to false to include x among descendants.
        Returns:
        the proper/improper descendants of x.

      • getNoOfDescendantLeaves

        int getNoOfDescendantLeaves(int x,
                          boolean properOnly)
        Returns the number of descendants of a vertex. Equivalent to getNoOfSuccessorSinks(), but extended with the possibility to count the vertex itself.
        Parameters:
        x - the vertex.
        properOnly - set to false to include x among descendants.
        Returns:
        the number of proper/improper descendants of x.

      • getParent

        int getParent(int x)
        Returns the immediate parent of x. If x is itself the root, NULL (as defined in the interface) is returned.
        Parameters:
        x - the vertex.
        Returns:
        z so that there is an arc (z,x).

      • getAncestors

        java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> getAncestors(int x,
                                             boolean properOnly)
        Returns the vertices from x to and including the root, so that element i is the parent of element i-1. If no such path exists, an empty list is returned.
        Parameters:
        x - the vertex.
        properOnly - set to true to start with the parent of x as first element, false to start with x.
        Returns:
        the proper/improper ancestors of x sorted so as to end with the root.

      • getNoOfAncestors

        int getNoOfAncestors(int x,
                   boolean properOnly)
        Returns the number of vertices from x to and including the root.
        Parameters:
        x - the vertex.
        properOnly - set to true to exclude x itself from the count, false to include x.
        Returns:
        the number of proper/improper ancestors of x.

      • getLeaves

        java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> getLeaves()
        Returns the leaves of the tree. Never null, as there is always at least one vertex. Equivalent to getSinks(). There is no guarantee that the list appears sorted or in any particular order.
        Returns:
        the leaves of the tree.

      • getNoOfLeaves

        int getNoOfLeaves()
        Returns the number of leaves of the tree. Equivalent to getNoOfSinks().
        Returns:
        the number of leaves.

      • getLCA

        int getLCA(int x,
         int y)
        Returns the "lowest common ancestor" (a.k.a. "least common ancestor" and "most recent common ancestor", MRCA) of two vertices x and y, i.e. the vertex z closest to x and y such that that there is a path (z,...,x) and a path (z,...,y), or x=y=z.
        Parameters:
        x - the first vertex.
        y - the second vertex.
        Returns:
        the lowest common ancestor of x and y.

      • isRoot

        boolean isRoot(int x)
        Returns true if a specified vertex is the root. Equivalent to isSource(...).
        Parameters:
        x - the vertex.
        Returns:
        true if x is the root.

      • isLeaf

        boolean isLeaf(int x)
        Returns true if a specified vertex is a leaf. Equivalent to isSink(...).
        Parameters:
        x - the vertex.
        Returns:
        true if x is a leaf.

      • getHeight

        int getHeight()
        Returns the length of the longest path in the tree, i.e. 0 for a single vertex tree, 1 for a "cherry", etc. The hypothetical "arc" predating the root is not counted. See also getNoOfAncestors(...) for the "reverse" height.
        Returns:
        the number of arcs of the longest path.

      • getHeight

        int getHeight(int x)
        Returns the length of the longest path from a vertex to its leaves, i.e. 0 if the vertex is itself a leaf, 1 if it is a "cherry", etc See also getNoOfAncestors(...) for the "reverse" height.
        Parameters:
        x - the vertex.
        Returns:
        the number of arcs of the longest leaf-path.
